abstract: The Nevada Republican Party has decided to push back the date of its presidential caucuses to Feb. 4 from Jan. 14, a move that brings a sense of order to an otherwise chaotic primary calendar and keeps New Hampshire from scheduling its voting before the New Year.
snippet: The Nevada Republican Party has decided to push back the date of its presidential caucuses to Feb. 4 from Jan. 14, a move that brings a sense of order to an otherwise chaotic primary calendar and keeps New Hampshire from scheduling its voting before...
lead_paragraph: The Nevada Republican Party decided on Saturday to push back the date of its presidential caucuses to Feb. 4, a move that brings a sense of order to an otherwise chaotic primary calendar and keeps New Hampshire from scheduling its voting before the New Year.

headline.main: Nevada G.O.P. Relents on Early Primary
